column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Buy the Copyright for an Old Book
#Text=If an old book still has a following but is no longer in print , buying the copyright is a good way for writers or publishers to meet the demand and earn extra money .
#Text=Obtaining the copyright to old books is also a good way to start an online collection of books to share or sell .
#Text=However , it is essential to understand copyright law and to follow the proper procedure in order to avoid possible legal objections from the original copyright holder or his or her heirs .
#Text=The process to transfer copyright is straightforward , but it can be time consuming .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Locate the original copyright holder of the old book .
#Text=This will be the person or company you will work with to transfer copyright from the original owner to you .
#Text=Look at the copyright page of the book to find the original author 's name and the original publisher 's name and location .
#Text=This should tell you whether the author or publisher holds the copyright .
#Text=Contact the government department that handles intellectual property rights if the information is missing or illegible .
#Text=You can request a search of copyright records to locate the copyright holder .
#Text=The department may use a name like the copyright office .
#Text=You can try the United States Copyright Office , the Canadian Intellectual Property Office or the German Copyright and Publishing Law Directorate .
#Text=Determine whether the copyright is still in effect .
#Text=Time limits on copyright vary by country .
#Text=If the copyright has expired , the book is in the public domain , and you will not need to do further research .
#Text=If the book is in the public domain , you wo n't need to buy the copyright .
#Text=Public domain books are the property of the public at large , and you may use , modify or republish the work .
#Text=Track down the copyright holder or his or her heirs .
#Text=Copyright extends beyond the death of the author , so you need to find the person who has the authority to transfer copyright to you .
#Text=Contact the copyright owner and explain why you want to buy the copyright of the old book .
#Text=Negotiate the terms to purchase the copyright .
#Text=You and the copyright holder can decide on terms that are beneficial to both parties .
#Text=You do n't necessarily need to hire a copyright attorney .
#Text=However , if the copyright transfer involves a large amount of money or the copyright owner has specific demands , it may be best to have an attorney draft a contract for the purchase .
#Text=Complete the purchase and record the transfer of copyright with the copyright office or other appropriate government agency .
#Text=The copyright office can provide the forms necessary to transfer the copyright legally .
#Text=Tips

#Text=You can often find publisher contact information in Bowker 's Books in Print database and author information in the Authors Registry or the Writers , Artists , and Their Copyright Holders ( WATCH ) database .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Not all countries require authors to file copyright notices with the government .
#Text=For example , Australia does not have a system for copyright registration ; all works have a copyright upon creation .

#Text=If you cannot locate the copyright holder and the copyright office cannot provide the copyright information , you will need to do more research to try to find the original author or his or her heirs .
#Text=Orphan works are copyrighted pieces of work whose copyright owner cannot be found .
#Text=It may be risky to re-publish orphan works since the original copyright holder may come forward later and assert a claim .
